intro: Loxodera, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Polygonaceae. These plants are characterized by their upright, herbaceous stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are small and clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences, typically greenish or reddish in color. Loxodera species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and are often found in woodland or shady areas. They have a long growing season and can thrive in moist, well-drained soils.
